function_arguments.overview: Technical- and compliance-heavy SSES proposal structured to clearly satisfy every mandatory requirement, demonstrate rigorous project management, and differentiate Aurelia via governance, data/analytics strength, and security/compliance maturity. Narrative will walk NFWB from understanding of LaSalle SSO context through Phase 1 SSES execution, NYSDEC-acceptable reporting, post-construction monitoring, and scalable options for Phases 2 and 3.

sections.title: Executive Summary and Win Themes
sections.summary: Concise overview of NFWB’s SSO challenges, Phase 1–3 SSES objectives, Aurelia’s understanding, and the value proposition: on-time NYSDEC-acceptable deliverables, strong governance, and data-driven I&I reduction with clear risk mitigation.
suggested_diagrams: flowchart showing linkage between Phase 1 SSES, corrective actions, construction, and post-construction monitoring through June 2024
suggested_charts: bar chart comparing planned timelines for Phase 1, Phase 2, and Phase 3 at a high level
suggested_tables: summary table of mandatory requirements cross-walked to proposal sections and page numbers
high-level benefits table summarizing NFWB value (schedule certainty, NYSDEC compliance, I&I reduction, MWBE/SDVOB participation)

sections.title: Understanding of NFWB Objectives, LaSalle Sewersheds, and Regulatory Context
sections.summary: Demonstrate deep understanding of LaSalle SSO abatement context, Phase 1–3 sewersheds, history of I&I reduction efforts, Order on Consent, NYSDEC expectations, and Engineering Report Outline requirements.
suggested_diagrams: system context diagram of LaSalle sewersheds showing Phase 1, 2, and 3 areas and outfalls
timeline diagram of Order on Consent milestones, SSES phases, construction, and monitoring through June 2024
suggested_charts: line chart illustrating illustrative I&I trends vs. rainfall (conceptual, to show understanding of analysis approach)
suggested_tables: table summarizing each sewershed (Phase 1, 2, 3) with key attributes: area, outfalls, known SSO issues, prior I&I work
table mapping NYSDEC Engineering Report Outline sections to proposed SSES report structure

sections.title: Regulatory and Standards Compliance Approach (NYSDEC, EPG, Engineering Report Outline)
sections.summary: Explain how all work products (SSES report, post-construction report) will conform to NYSDEC, EPG guidance, and Engineering Report Outline (Oct 1, 2022), including PE stamping and structured review checkpoints.
suggested_diagrams: flowchart of internal quality and compliance review process leading to PE-stamped deliverables acceptable to NYSDEC
suggested_tables: compliance matrix table mapping NYSDEC Engineering Report Outline elements to planned report sections and responsible roles

sections.title: Phase 1 SSES Technical Approach and Scope of Services
sections.summary: Detailed description of Phase 1 SSES tasks in 91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1 sewersheds, including investigation, analysis, reporting, and post-construction monitoring, structured by tasks aligned with the RFP.
suggested_diagrams: work-breakdown structure diagram for Phase 1 tasks from data review through field work, analysis, reporting, and monitoring
sequence diagram showing coordination between Aurelia, NFWB staff, and NYSDEC across project phases
suggested_charts: gantt-style bar chart (high level) showing sequencing of Phase 1 tasks (data review, field investigations, analysis, reporting, construction support, post-construction monitoring)
suggested_tables: task-by-task scope table describing objectives, key activities, inputs, and deliverables for Phase 1
RACI table for Aurelia vs. NFWB vs. NYSDEC roles for major tasks

sections.title: Data Review, Existing Information Assessment, and System Familiarization
sections.summary: Describe methodology for reviewing existing data (Order on Consent, prior reports, CCTV, manhole inspections, SCADA data), meeting with staff, and gaining operational understanding of LaSalle sewersheds and flow management.
suggested_diagrams: process diagram for data intake, validation, GIS integration, and gap analysis leading to focused SSES planning
suggested_charts: bar chart summarizing categories of existing data (CCTV, manhole, flow, rainfall) and their coverage/completeness (conceptual)
suggested_tables: inventory table of existing data types and intended use in analysis
table of planned coordination meetings and objectives with NFWB and NYSDEC

sections.title: Smoke Testing Plan and Methodology
sections.summary: Provide detailed Phase 1 smoke testing approach: criteria for test areas, weather constraints, staffing, equipment, safety, resident notification, coordination with police/fire, documentation, and integration of findings into I&I analysis.
suggested_diagrams: flowchart of end-to-end smoke testing workflow from planning and notifications to field execution and defect logging into GIS
suggested_charts: pie chart showing expected distribution of defect types discovered via smoke testing (conceptual, to show analytical approach)
suggested_tables: table of smoke testing procedures including safety checks, communication steps, and documentation requirements

sections.title: Night-Time Flow Isolation and Measurement (Weiring) Approach
sections.summary: Explain the technical plan for nighttime flow isolation and weiring: selection of locations, review of prior flow data, staffing and equipment, traffic control, confined space entry, resident notifications, and analytical methods to calculate infiltration rates in gpd/lf.
suggested_diagrams: sequence diagram for a typical weiring operation from setup to demobilization and data upload
diagram showing measurement points along a sewer segment and calculation of infiltration per linear foot
suggested_charts: line chart showing example nighttime flow hydrographs before/after isolation to illustrate analysis approach
suggested_tables: table of candidate weir locations with selection criteria and constraints (conceptual plan)

sections.title: CCTV, Manhole, and Focused SSES Activities (Dye Testing, House Inspections)
sections.summary: Detail how existing CCTV and manhole inspection data will be reviewed, how additional CCTV by NFWB crews will be coordinated, and how focused SSES activities (dye testing, house inspections) will be planned and executed using the $10,000 contingency.
suggested_diagrams: flowchart showing decision process for triggering focused SSES activities based on initial findings and contingency budget authorization
suggested_charts: bar chart comparing number of defects by type from CCTV vs. manhole vs. focused SSES (conceptual)
suggested_tables: table summarizing NASSCO PACP condition grades and corresponding recommended actions
contingency usage tracking table for Task 6 focused SSES work

sections.title: Outfall/SSO Condition Assessment for 91st & Luick and 81st & Frontier 1
sections.summary: Describe the work plan for assessing Phase 1 outfalls, including review of existing data, site visits, development of a detailed Work Plan, potential use of meters/gauges/dye testing/CCTV, GIS-compatible documentation, and recommendations to reduce extraneous flows.
suggested_diagrams: site layout diagrams for each outfall showing monitoring points and instrumentation options
flowchart of Work Plan development, approval by NFWB, and execution steps
suggested_charts: before/after bar chart concept for outfall flow rates pre- and post-corrective actions (conceptual)
suggested_tables: table summarizing each outfall, existing issues, proposed assessment techniques, and expected outputs

sections.title: Phase 1 Engineering Analysis, Corrective Action Planning, and SSES Report
sections.summary: Explain analytical methods to identify I&I sources, prioritize cost-effective corrective actions, develop budgetary cost estimates and implementation timelines, and structure the Phase 1 SSES report to be acceptable to NYSDEC and stamped by a NYS PE.
suggested_diagrams: analysis workflow diagram from raw field data through QA/QC, hydraulic assessment, I&I quantification, and alternatives evaluation
decision tree diagram for selecting corrective action types based on defect characteristics and cost-effectiveness
suggested_charts: bar chart comparing cost vs. I&I reduction for candidate corrective actions
timeline chart showing planned implementation windows for recommended improvements
suggested_tables: corrective action alternatives evaluation matrix (criteria such as effectiveness, constructability, cost, schedule impact)
outline table of the SSES report structure mapped to NYSDEC requirements
table of budgetary cost estimates and associated I&I reduction assumptions

sections.title: Post-Construction Monitoring and I&I Reduction Assessment
sections.summary: Describe the 2024 post-construction monitoring program, including flow and rainfall monitoring methods, comparison to pre-construction conditions, and preparation of the Post-Construction I&I Assessment and Cost Analysis Report for NYSDEC.
suggested_diagrams: process diagram showing monitoring setup, data collection, normalization for rainfall, and reporting steps
suggested_charts: before/after line charts of flow vs. rainfall to demonstrate I&I reduction
bar chart showing I&I reduction by sub-area and associated cost per gallon removed
suggested_tables: table comparing pre- and post-construction flow metrics by sewershed segment
table summarizing most effective techniques and associated unit costs

sections.title: Options for Phase 2 and Phase 3 SSES (Scope, Schedule, and Fees)
sections.summary: Present Option 1 (Phase 2) and Option 2 (Phase 3) scopes, schedules, and fees, clearly identifying how tasks differ (e.g., no outfall assessment in Phase 2, one outfall in Phase 3) and how lessons from Phase 1 will be leveraged.
suggested_diagrams: gantt-style diagram comparing Phase 1, Phase 2, and Phase 3 timelines and dependencies
suggested_charts: stacked bar chart comparing effort and budget allocation by task across Phases 1, 2, and 3
suggested_tables: side-by-side comparison table of scope elements for Phase 1, Phase 2, and Phase 3
option pricing table for Phase 2 and Phase 3 with not-to-exceed amounts and assumptions

sections.title: Project Management, Governance, and Communication Plan
sections.summary: Detail Aurelia’s project management framework, designation of Project Manager, governance structure, coordination with NFWB and NYSDEC, risk management, and approach to pre-proposal session attendance and RFP question handling.
suggested_diagrams: RACI diagram for project roles and responsibilities
communication flowchart showing interactions between Aurelia, NFWB staff, NYSDEC, and other stakeholders
project governance lifecycle diagram aligned to Aurelia’s Initiate/Discover/Design/Build/Deploy/Operate phases
suggested_charts: risk heat map chart summarizing key project risks (e.g., weather, access, data gaps) and mitigation strategies
suggested_tables: project organization table listing key roles, names, and responsibilities
communication plan table listing meeting types, frequency, participants, and purpose
risk register table with probability, impact, and mitigation actions

sections.title: Schedule, Level of Effort, and Budget (Including Contingency)
sections.summary: Provide detailed schedule in bar chart form and effort/budget breakdown using a task/hour estimate matrix, including not-to-exceed fee and $10,000 contingency for Task 6, plus pricing for Phase 2 and 3 options and acknowledgement of 60-day payment terms and tax-exempt status.
suggested_diagrams: gantt chart showing detailed schedule for Phase 1 tasks and milestone dates for NYSDEC reviews and construction windows
suggested_charts: stacked bar chart showing allocation of hours by role and task
pie chart showing budget distribution across major task categories and phases
suggested_tables: task/hour estimate matrix by role for each task and phase
pricing breakdown table with not-to-exceed fee, contingency, and option pricing
cash flow projection table aligned to monthly invoicing expectations

sections.title: Team Qualifications, Experience, and Staffing Plan
sections.summary: Present Aurelia’s and any subconsultants’ qualifications, key personnel resumes and specific experience, business structure, licensing, years in business, relevant references, and staffing plan ensuring adequate and competent personnel and compliance with credentialing and safety requirements.
suggested_diagrams: organizational chart of the project team including Aurelia and any subconsultants
suggested_charts: bar chart summarizing years of relevant experience per key role
suggested_tables: team qualifications table listing education, licenses, and relevant project experience for key staff
subconsultant summary table including scope share (>10%), MWBE/SDVOB status, and references
staffing plan table mapping roles to planned time commitments over the project timeline

sections.title: MWBE and SDVOB Participation Strategy
sections.summary: Explain strategy to meet or exceed MWBE (30% combined) and SDVOB (6%) participation goals, including identification of certified partners, utilization plans, and approach to monthly reporting and, if needed, waiver requests.
suggested_diagrams: process diagram for MWBE/SDVOB partner engagement, onboarding, and ongoing utilization tracking
suggested_charts: stacked bar chart showing planned distribution of contract value among prime, MWBE, and SDVOB firms
suggested_tables: MWBE/SDVOB utilization plan table listing firms, certification numbers, scopes, and dollar values
reporting calendar table for monthly MWBE-SDVOB and prevailing wage reports

sections.title: Health, Safety, and Site-Specific Risk Management
sections.summary: Describe Aurelia’s Safety Program and approach to Site-Specific Health & Safety Plans, including hazard identification for field work (confined space, traffic control, night operations), PPE, OSHA training, monitoring, and compliance with all safety regulations.
suggested_diagrams: site safety workflow diagram from pre-job briefing through field execution and post-job review
suggested_charts: risk matrix chart categorizing safety risks by likelihood and severity
suggested_tables: health and safety responsibilities table by role
summary table of required training and certifications for field staff (e.g., confined space, traffic control)

sections.title: Security, Data Management, and Information Governance
sections.summary: Leverage Aurelia’s security and data strengths to explain how project data (CCTV, flow, GIS, reports) will be securely stored, shared, and managed; address NYS information security breach notification, FOIL-sensitive information, and data retention requirements.
suggested_diagrams: data flow diagram showing movement of data from field collection to secure storage, analysis, and reporting
suggested_charts: bar chart summarizing data types vs. retention periods
suggested_tables: table mapping data categories to security controls, retention periods, and FOIL considerations

sections.title: Commercial Terms, Insurance, and Legal Compliance
sections.summary: Confirm acceptance of key commercial and legal terms including insurance coverage, indemnification, prevailing wage, non-discrimination, lobbying law, non-collusion, conflicts of interest, waiver of immunity, termination, and record-keeping requirements.
suggested_tables: insurance coverage table listing required types, limits, carriers, and additional insureds
compliance attestations checklist table referencing each required certification and form
summary table of key contractual terms (e.g., termination, governing law, venue) with confirmation statements

sections.title: Administrative Requirements and Proposal Submission Plan
sections.summary: Outline how Aurelia will comply with all administrative instructions: pre-proposal meeting attendance, question submission, addenda acknowledgment, proposal packaging (original, copies, electronic), deadlines, and handling of exceptions in a separate attachment.
suggested_diagrams: timeline diagram of key procurement dates (pre-proposal session, question deadline, proposal due date, anticipated award)
suggested_tables: proposal submission checklist table covering all required forms, copies, and packaging details
table listing all exceptions (if any) with rationale and proposed alternative language

sections.title: Required Forms and Certifications (Appendix E & F)
sections.summary: Identify all required Appendix E and F forms (Standard Terms, EEO, Non-Collusion, Lobbying, Sexual Harassment, MWBE/SDVOB, etc.), confirm completion and inclusion, and summarize any waivers or special circumstances.
suggested_tables: forms tracking table listing each required form, responsible party, and status (completed/signed/included)

sections.title: Appendices: Detailed Resumes, Reference Projects, and Supporting Materials
sections.summary: Provide detailed resumes of key staff, expanded project descriptions for similar SSES or utilities work, letters of commitment from subconsultants, and any additional technical materials supporting the proposal.
suggested_tables: reference projects table summarizing client, scope, year, and relevance to NFWB SSES
resume index table mapping key personnel to sections of the proposal

key_themes: NYSDEC compliance and audit-ready documentation, explicitly mapped to Engineering Report Outline and EPG requirements
On-time delivery aligned to NFWB’s need for early 2023 NYSDEC review, 2023–early 2024 construction, and June 2024 post-construction monitoring
Data-driven I&I identification and reduction, using rigorous analysis of flow, rainfall, CCTV, and smoke testing results
Strong project governance and communication, leveraging Aurelia’s Initiate–Operate lifecycle and clear stage gates
Robust safety, security, and information governance practices that reduce NFWB’s operational and reputational risk
Commitment to MWBE and SDVOB participation with a practical, credible utilization plan
Transparent pricing and effort estimation with clear not-to-exceed amounts and contingency control
Experienced multidisciplinary team with proven utilities and public-sector delivery experience
Collaborative partnership with NFWB and NYSDEC, emphasizing consensus-building on scope, findings, and corrective actions
function_arguments.win_strategy: Position Aurelia as the lowest-risk, highest-value partner by tightly aligning the proposal to every RFP requirement, especially NYSDEC compliance, schedule, and MWBE/SDVOB goals. Emphasize a structured, lifecycle-based project approach that mirrors the SSES phases and NFWB’s Order on Consent milestones, with explicit mapping to the NYS Engineering Report Outline and PE-stamped deliverables. Differentiate on governance and data/analytics capabilities: show how Aurelia will integrate and analyze flow, rainfall, CCTV, and smoke testing data to prioritize the most cost-effective corrective actions and to clearly demonstrate I&I reduction in the post-construction report. Highlight a robust project management and communication framework with a named Project Manager, clear RACI, and proactive coordination with NFWB and NYSDEC to de-risk schedule and regulatory approvals. Demonstrate readiness to meet or exceed MWBE/SDVOB participation and prevailing wage obligations through a concrete utilization plan and reporting cadence. Reduce perceived commercial and legal risk by explicitly accepting key terms (insurance, indemnity, record-keeping, non-discrimination, lobbying, non-collusion) and by providing a complete, organized set of required forms and certifications. Finally, present option pricing and scalable methods for Phases 2 and 3 that leverage Phase 1 learning, offering NFWB a coherent multi-phase roadmap rather than isolated tasks.
